intro: Stellaria ruderalis, commonly known as the common mouse-ear or field mouse-ear, is a flowering plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It is a low-growing annual herb that typically reaches heights of 10–30 centimeters. The plant has small, white to pinkish flowers that bloom in clusters, and its leaves are usually oval or rounded with a hairy texture. Stellaria ruderalis thrives in disturbed soils, often found in fields, roadsides, and waste areas. It is characterized by its ability to spread rapidly and is often considered a weed in agricultural settings.
